snippet: Security officials and their critics in Congress are sparring over whether current measures would have detected the latest underwear bomb.
abstract: Latest attempt by Al Qaeda to make an underwear bomb designed to be detonated on a plane headed to the United States sets off a fierce debate among security officials in Washington and their critics in Congress about whether the current measures to protect airliners would have detected the bomb.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and RON NIXON
byline.contributor: John H. Cushman Jr. contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Security officials and their critics in Congress are sparring over whether current measures would have detected the latest underwear bomb.

headline.main: Airplane Security Debated Anew After Latest Bombing Plot
headline.print_headline: Airplane Security Debated Anew After Latest Bombing Plot

keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
keywords.name: organizations
